greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A085956(3n+1).
comment: A086361 and A086362 includes most probably the solvable [or small?] cases of A085956, where n=3k-1 has probably only two solutions, at [k,n,a(n)]=[1,2,13] and at [2,5,31].
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: n=50:3n+1=151,6n+2=302, a(50)=93923 prime with (93922-1)/302=311, prime and with 302.93923+1=28364747 prime; so the {311,93923,28364747} "generalized [short] Cunningham-chain" is defined.
mathematica: Table[Function[m, p = 2; While[Nand @@ PrimeQ@ {2 m p + 1, (p - 1)/(2 m)}, p = NextPrime@ p]; p][3 n + 1], {n, 0, 41}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 15 2017 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 22 2003
